summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior.

We have class VitsConfig: configuration class for VitsModel (text-to-speech). It stores hyperparameters for model architecture: vocab size, hidden size, transformer encoder layers, attention heads, flow layers, HiFi-GAN upsampling, etc. Business intent: to define and customize VITS TTS model architecture for speech synthesis, enabling reproducible model instantiation and fine-tuning. Keywords: configuration, VITS, text-to-speech, transformer encoder, flow, HiFi-GAN, hyperparameters, speech synthesis, model architecture, speaker embedding, duration predictor, sampling rate, etc.

Now produce JSON.

Make sure summary concise: "Configuration container for VITS text-to-speech model, encapsulating all architectural hyperparameters such as transformer encoder settings, flow modules, HiFi‑GAN upsampler, speaker embeddings, and inference controls."

Business intent: "Allows users to specify and reproduce the exact VITS model architecture for training or inference, facilitating customization of speech synthesis systems."

Keywords list.

Let's craft.

JSON must start with {{ and end with }}? The instruction says "Output ONLY valid JSON starting with {{ and ending with }}. Example: {{\"summary\": \"...\", \"business_intent\": \"...\", \"keywords\": [\"k1\", \"k2\"]}}". So they want double curly braces? That's not standard JSON but they ask. We'll follow.

Thus output:

{{"summary": "...", "business_intent": "...", "keywords": [...]}}

Make sure no extra spaces? It's okay.

Let's craft final answer.assistantfinal{{"summary": "A configuration container for the VITS text-to-speech model that holds all architectural hyperparameters, including transformer encoder dimensions, attention settings, flow stages, HiFi‑GAN upsampling parameters, speaker embedding options, duration prediction controls, and audio sampling specifications.", "business_intent": "Enables developers to define, reproduce, and customize the exact VITS model architecture for training or inference, supporting flexible speech synthesis deployments and fine‑tuning across different speakers and audio qualities.", "keywords": ["VITS", "text-to-speech", "configuration", "hyperparameters", "transformer encoder", "flow model", "HiFi-GAN upsampler", "speaker embedding", "duration predictor", "sampling rate", "speech synthesis
